stem: After attending a dinner party, 10 participants developed nausea and vomiting, abdominal cramps, and diarrhea within 6 hours. Most of them recovered spontaneously but few required admission to correct the dehydration. The most likely etiology is,
disc:
The timing of the onset of symptoms from exposure is important.
- < 6 hours: suggests preformed toxins from Staphylococcus aureus or Bacillus cereus. Often the symptoms are nausea and vomiting.
- 8-6 hours: suggests Clostridium perfringens
- >16 hours: other bacterial or viral causes (e.g. enterotoxins)
